channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Garrett Graff, When the Seas Came Alive - An Oral History Of D-Day
channel.desc: Author Garrett Graff discusses his oral history of the allied invasion of Normandy, France, on June 6, 1944.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This U.S. Army film details the logistics of treating wounded soldiers in the field and in hospitals in England during and after the D-Day invasion of Normandy, France on June 6, 1944.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: A look at the people and events that shaped the American Civil War and Reconstruction.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Negro Cloth & Enslaved People
channel.desc: Professor Jonathan Square discusses 'Lowell Cloth', also called 'Negro Cloth,' that was produced in Lowell, Massachusetts, and worn by enslaved people.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Peace & Reconciliation After the Vietnam War
channel.desc: Fifty years after the conflict ended in 1975, the Stimson Center in Washington, D.C., hosts a discussion on the Vietnam War and its legacy.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Legacies of the Vietnam War
channel.desc: Fifty years after the conflict ended in 1975, the Stimson Center in Washington, D.C., hosts a discussion on the Vietnam War and its legacy.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: American History TV
channel.desc: Airing weekends, "American History TV" offers programming about people and events that document the American story, geared toward history aficionados. Shows that air under the "American History TV" banner cover the history of the nation, from its founding in the 18th century through modern times. Topics covered include the Civil War, presidents and the exploration of historical sites.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: From Saigon to the White House - A Vietnamese Refugee's Story
channel.desc: France Hoang's family fled Vietnam in 1975 at the end of the war - and his journey has taken him from child refugee to West Point to combat zones to the White House.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Diane Kiesel, When Charlie Met Joan
channel.desc: Diane Kiesel - a retired New York Supreme Court judge - talks about legendary actor Charlie Chaplin's legal trials and the implications for American law, celebrity culture, and Cold War politics.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Sen. Dave McCormick and Dina McCormick, Who Believed in You?
channel.desc: Sen. Dave McCormick (R-PA) and his wife Dina McCormick discuss the importance of mentors and share stories of successful politicians and business leaders who have had their lives changed by them.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Jeanne Theoharis, King of the North - Martin Luther King Jr.'s Life of Struggle Outside the South
channel.desc: Political Science professor Jeanne Theoharis argues that it was Martin Luther King's fight in the north that was the center of his push for racial justice.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: Author Stephanie Land ("Maid: Hard Work, Low Pay, and a Mother's Will to Survive") discusses her path from working as a maid to earning a journalism degree and later writing about the working poor.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Sen. Dave McCormick and Dina McCormick, Who Believed in You?
channel.desc: Sen. Dave McCormick (R-PA) and his wife Dina McCormick discuss the importance of mentors and share stories of successful politicians and business leaders who have had their lives changed by them.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Jeanne Theoharis, King of the North - Martin Luther King Jr.'s Life of Struggle Outside the South
channel.desc: Political Science professor Jeanne Theoharis argues that it was Martin Luther King's fight in the north that was the center of his push for racial justice.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: About Books
channel.desc: Author Katie Mitchell highlights the importance and history of Black bookstores in her new book, "Prose to the People"; a report on the latest publishing industry news and current non-fiction books.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Nick Adams, From Mar-a-Lago to Mars
channel.desc: Foundation for Liberty and American Greatness (FLAG) founder Nick Adams talks about Donald Trump's successful 2024 campaign for president.

channel.title: Rick Atkinson, The Fate of the Day
